central_thesis: This document outlines a rigorous, multi-stage methodology for conducting a remote viewing session, designed to systematically extract, categorize, and document non-local information about a target site while minimizing subjective interpretation, culminating in a comprehensive 'Site Template'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Produce a Freehand Symbolic Sketch for the Site
structure_content.summary: This initial phase guides the viewer through fundamental steps to establish a foundational understanding of the target site. It begins with the generation of a spontaneous ideogram (S1[Site]) triggered by target reference numbers. Following this, the viewer lists sensory impressions across categories such as textures, colors, smells, tastes, temperatures, sounds, and dimensions, alongside a single 'AI word' describing the site's overall emotional impact (S2[Site]). The phase concludes with a freehand symbolic sketch (S3[Site]) depicting key site aspects as archetypes, including motion direction and labels indicating their perceived order of importance.

structure_content.chapter_title: Produce an Analytical Sketch and S4 for each Site Aspect
structure_content.summary: Building upon the initial site sketch, this phase focuses on detailed exploration of each individual key aspect identified in S3[Site] (e.g., [X], [A], [B], etc.). For each aspect, the process recursively applies modified S1, S2, S3, and a new S4 stage. This involves creating a new ideogram specific to the aspect (S1[X]), followed by an in-depth listing of its sensory impressions, requiring at least four dimensions and a single 'AI word' describing the aspect's feeling (S2[X]). From these S2[X] Dimension words, an 'Analytical Sketch' (S3[X]) is drawn as a line rendering. The phase concludes with 'Systematic Aspect Exploration' (S4[X]), a structured method to deepen perception by placing word-ideas into columns and observing for emerging percepts through methodical page scanning.

structure_content.chapter_title: Construct the Site Template using the Analytical Sketches
structure_content.summary: The final stage involves integrating all the data collected throughout the session into a cohesive 'Site Template'. This is achieved by combining all individual analytical sketches (S3[X], S3[A], S3[B], etc.) into a single, unified diagram on a new sheet of paper. While the scale of individual sketches may be adjusted, their original orientation and relationships must be preserved. Additionally, all collected 'AI', 'EI', 'T', and 'I' words (representing associated impressions, emotional impact, temporal data, and dimensional data, respectively) from the S4 exploration pages are meticulously transcribed and placed in their corresponding locations within the composite site template.

key_concepts.definition: A spontaneous, freehand symbolic sketch generated immediately upon receiving target reference numbers (S1[Site]) or when initiating focus on a specific site aspect (S1[X]). It serves as an initial capture of raw, non-local data.

A structured and ordered listing of perceived data across various sensory categories, including Textures, Colors, Smells, Tastes, Temperatures, Sounds, and Dimensions. For S2[X], it must include at least four dimensions.
An archetypal drawing of the overall site's key aspects, intended to depict motion direction using arrowheads. These aspects are labeled in order of perceived importance ([X], [A], [B], etc.).
A detailed line drawing of a specific site aspect, constructed *exclusively* from the 'Dimension words' generated during the S2[X] phase. Motion arrowheads or arrows may be included as needed.

A structured method for deepening perception on an individual aspect. It involves consciously placing nascent 'word-ideas' into designated columns as they enter awareness, allowing for the emergence of 'percepts' through a methodical scanning process (left-to-right, top-to-bottom, and back again) to a two-thirds point down the page.

An 'Associated Impression' word, chosen to concisely describe the subjective feeling or emotional impact evoked by the target site (S2[Site]) or a specific aspect (S2[X]). The protocol limits this to a single word to reduce analytical overlay.

The final, integrated composite diagram of the remote viewing session. It combines all individual Analytical Sketches (S3[X]) into a unified representation, augmented by relevant AI, EI, T, and I words (derived from S4 explorations) placed in their corresponding positions.

An acronym, likely 'Site Specific Basic Percept' (inferred), used in S1[X] to denote the foundational, raw perceptual data associated with a particular aspect [X], serving as the starting point for a new ideogram.

practical_system.description: The system presents a comprehensive, multi-phase operational procedure for conducting a remote viewing session. It mandates a progression from initial spontaneous ideograms to detailed analytical sketches of individual aspects, culminating in a synthesized 'Site Template'. The core philosophy emphasizes disciplined data acquisition, categorization, and reduction of subjective 'noise' to achieve a coherent and 'objective' psychic readout of a target. The method encourages speed in initial stages and methodical exploration in later phases.
tools: Paper (new sheets for sketches and site template)
Target reference numbers (for initial session focus)
rituals: Initial Site Data Acquisition (S1-S3 Site): Receive target numbers, produce a spontaneous Ideogram (S1[Site], 2s max). List Sensory Impressions (S2[Site]), including one AI word. Draw a Freehand Symbolic Sketch of key site aspects as archetypes, depicting motion and labeling by importance (S3[Site], 15s max).

Aspect-Specific Exploration (S1[X]-S4[X] for each aspect): For each labeled aspect ([X], [A], [B], etc.), produce a new Ideogram (S1[X], 2s max) after writing 'From the top of [X] SSBP'. Collect detailed Sensory Impressions (S2[X], 2-3 min, 4+ dimensions), including one AI word. Create an Analytical Sketch (S3[X], 1-2 min) using only S2[X] Dimension words as line drawings. Conduct Systematic Aspect Exploration (S4[X], 3-6 min) by placing word-ideas in columns and scanning for percepts.

Site Template Construction: Combine all individual Analytical Sketches (S3[X], S3[A], etc.) into a single, unified diagram on a new sheet, maintaining original element relationships and orientations (scale adjustable). Transfer all AI, EI, T, and I words from S4 pages to their respective places on the Site Template.

relevant_quotes.text: Write the target reference numbers and immediately produce a spontaneous ideogram.

Allow your hand to deliberately find and draw the key site aspects, as archetypes. Remember to depict motion direction with arrowheads. Label key site aspects in order of importance as [X], [A], [B], etc.
Using only your S2[X] Dimension words, carefully render each word-idea as a line drawing. Use motion arrowheads or arrows, if needed.

As soon as a word-idea enters conscious awareness, place it in the correct column. Or, place your pen in a column and wait a moment to see if a percept arises. Move your pen from left to right, top to bottom, and back again, until you hit the two-thirds point down the page.
It is futile to attempt analysis when a remote viewing session is incomplete, i.e., one in which a Site Template has not been properly executed.

critical_analysis.relevance: This flowchart offers a meticulously structured protocol for remote viewing, a discipline within modern esotericism that seeks to systematize and operationalize psychic perception. Its emphasis on sequential stages, distinct data categories, and the isolation of 'AI words' aligns with methodologies developed to minimize 'analytic overlay' (subjective interpretation) and enhance the perceived objectivity of clairvoyant data, akin to scientific or intelligence-gathering applications. This rigorous approach makes it highly relevant to practitioners seeking a disciplined, repeatable method for accessing non-local information, contrasting with more free-form occult practices by providing a clear, step-by-step 'magical formula' for psychic engagement.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for this flowchart includes serious practitioners of remote viewing, students of structured psychic phenomena, intelligence community personnel involved in or studying ESP applications, and individuals within practical occultism who prioritize systematic methods for developing and documenting extrasensory perception, aiming for consistent and verifiable results over unguided intuitive experiences.
